definition: back (of a human or other vertebrate)
the back of a body or object/to turn one's back/to hide something from/to learn by heart/to recite from memory/unlucky (slang)/hard of hearing
to be burdened/to carry on the back or shoulder

sentences.english: Do not make a rod for your own Back.
sentences.chinese: 不要爲你自己的脊背做一條笞鞭。

sentences.english: He fixes his eyes on the greyish spine of the old wolf as he swoops down.
sentences.chinese: 他兩眼死死盯住老狼灰黑的脊背。

sentences.english: No kingdom should be made on the backs of slaves.
sentences.chinese: 國家不能建立在奴隸的脊背上。

sentences.english: She leapt backwards, back arched and fur on end, tail held out stiffly.
sentences.chinese: 她向後一躍，脊背拱起，毛髮豎立，尾巴僵直地伸着。

sentences.english: The words tingled down my spine like a spider.
sentences.chinese: 這話像蜘蛛爬上我的脊背一樣讓我一激靈。

sentences.english: Jialuo became shivered and gently stroked Laba's back;
sentences.chinese: 甲洛顫抖着用手輕撫拉巴的脊背。

sentences.english: It is the last straw that breaks the camel's back.
sentences.chinese: 最後添加的一根草壓斷駱駝的脊背。

sentences.english: He said the cliff was called Jiyu Bei，which means Carp's Backbone.
sentences.chinese: 他說那座懸崖叫作“鯽魚背”，意思就是鯽魚的脊背。

sentences.english: A trickle of moisture ran down his spine and made him shudder.
sentences.chinese: 一滴水自他的脊背留下讓他打了個寒戰。

sentences.english: Knowing their house was haunted sent shivers up and down my spine.
sentences.chinese: 知道他們的房子是鬼屋之後，我感到脊背發涼。

sentences.english: The Boys clapped him on the Back.
sentences.chinese: 小夥子們拍着他的脊背。

sentences.english: Something was crawling down his spine.
sentences.chinese: 有什麼東西在他脊背上爬下去。

sentences.english: The tiger humped his back before he sprang on the game.
sentences.chinese: 在捕捉獵物前，老虎弓起了他的脊背。

sentences.english: Now you face has deep wrinkles, your straight back already bent corners.
sentences.chinese: 如今您的臉上已皺紋深陷，您的筆直的脊背已然曲彎。
他得出一些令人脊背發涼的推論。

sentences.english: On my flight home from my holiday, I could barely sit up because of pain in my lower back.
sentences.chinese: 在回去的班機上，由於脊背的疼痛我幾乎無法直坐。

definition: the back of the human body
the back (human anatomy)/the back part of sth
